name: Tirzepatide
overview: Tirzepatide is a dual GIP and GLP-1 receptor agonist approved for type 2 diabetes management and chronic weight management. It acts on two incretin hormone pathways to regulate blood sugar and reduce appetite.
who_should_avoid: Those with personal or family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma
People with Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia syndrome type 2 (MEN 2)
interactions_notes: May increase hypoglycemia risk when combined with insulin or sulfonylureas. Can delay gastric emptying and affect oral medication absorption. Full medication review with prescriber is essential.
dosing_ranges_literature: Weight management protocols typically start at 2.5 mg weekly, escalating every 4 weeks to a target maintenance dose (often 5-15 mg weekly) as tolerated. Diabetes dosing may differ. Follow prescriber instructions.
storage_notes: Keep refrigerated before first use. After initial use, some formulations allow room temperature storage for a limited time. Refer to manufacturer guidelines.
